r_BzITecC20DO7ilEDvI8g.text: I am on a best fish & chip hunt in London and I have to say this place is not doing it.  Message me if you want my recommendations.Don't mistaken me, do try their other food.   And yes, my review is biased.Not gonna be back.The End.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Cod, Thumbs down. :(

yGiqeSZCXeCZ6UZioDQYJQ.text: I had a whole lobster, chips, mushy pea's and some of my friends chips too. It was officially a cheat day hahahahahahaha. The chips were amazing. Lobster was good too!

JMN21ncMWrJsQxMZMHbnUA.text: Is there some law against proper seasoning in England?It's unnerving. In all honesty, I probably respect cuisine in the UK a little more than the typical critic. From almost every casual gourmand I know, I've heard nothing but disdain for English cuisine, that it's essentially a symphony of bland. It's more or less true- most of the food I've had here have been lacking in taste and variety. That being said, while I don't respect tastelessness of the food here, I can respect their attention to texture. Their pastry and pie dough used in their dishes is excellently made, and their dishes are almost always appropriately crispy or soft. Which brings me to this travesty of a dish. I've tried the fish pie, fish and chips, and swordfish sandwich. All of them were excellent with regards to texture. The fish and chips were expertly fried, and the fish pie was smooth and melted in my mouth. Why oh why couldn't they be bothered to season the dishes appropriately? Have they never heard of lemon or garlic or salt or capers or paprika or any other of the myriad of seasoning options in existence today? I think that the air I breathed was more seasoned than the dishes at this place.

OCt01dGIoW5ukswsOF_Jcw.text: To be honest, the fish and chips is quite ordinary. However, that is sometimes the best way to have it. Deep fried fish plus some crunchy fries really hit the spot when you're hungry. My advice is not to eat it for dinner as it's heavy and not so healthy. Well, eat it once a week and you'll be fine. There are a few topings and sides to choose from but the real variety comes from all the seafood.

7sqQ47eRZXJ_92zzQ4K7dw.text: I came by here recently for an early-ish business dinner. The initial impression was mixed  I'd suggested this place as a venue, and wasn't desperately impressed by the honk of disinfectant on the way in. That said, having sampled a couple of shared starters ( calamari and whitebait  both light battered, and not as greasy as can sometimes be the case), and enjoyed an impressive piece of skate wing as a main, I was reasonably impressed. Service was as prompt as our lowly British expectations dictate, and the restaurant filled up quite convncingly as the evening wore in.All that said, the observations of our American guests were quite interesting, since they came from New England, which obviously considers itself a seafood centre of excellence. To recap some of the choicer ones:$15 for that?  in reference to a starterWhat's a vegetable garnish ?Maine lobster is the best  re. the scrawny British oneThat would give me palpitations  re. the double espresso at the end of the mealStill, it was pleasant enough. Neither the most impressive , nor the most over-priced seafood emporium I can think of in London, but on reflection, I think the Americans had a point  it's not world class.

3EoxzFb3-HXIf22od_R-DQ.text: I knew this place would be a treat the moment we walked past, the 4 of us, having visited the Borough Market. We had to wait a bit, but that's the norm these days. Once seated I looked around and saw that all the other diners were enjoying their food. Always a good sign.The fish was fresh, the wines on offer lovely, and the service attentive and prompt. Wha't not to like? Enjoy!

rPkuXHZxrQ-Vi4h5O1acpw.text: Huge variety of fish on the menu here means you are spoiled for choice. But Fish still has a very chainy feel to it, and If I am splurging on a nice seafood meal I would rather not do it in a large 'Fish Tank' with the rest of the world walking by and gawking through the window at my meal.My meal was ok, but I have had better. I tried the Tuna Burger and instead of a fillet of tuna (which is what I was hoping for), this was a mish-mash of tuna meat and other unknown ingredients. Quite expensive too considering the place is a glorified fish and chip shop, what are you paying for?

kwXuX29BJbK5PVk5nl4YMQ.text: My mom & I came for dinner after a long flight.  We were wandering around the Cathedral and loved that fish! had outdoor seating and a fresh looking menu. We sat outside which can be a bit noisy with the tourists walking by and the train overhead but it was pleasant and I could watch the torch relay on the one TV they had. Be sure to check out their daily specials, a few of them looked interesting. I chose salmon with herb butter served with a side of spinach.We shared their calamari. It was a bit over battered for my taste and served on a bed of greens. A bit expensive but totally worth it for fresh, sustainable fish!

wQ559reZvxHOewv2kcn4-A.text: Chips were better than average, nice and crispy. Halibut was pretty mushy. There was one empty bottle of ketchup. How do you run out of ketchup? There's only 5 seats in an alley to the left of the takeaway counter. Skin stays on the fish in Great Britain, FYI.

XfRGuGSAkEpxpVWxKtRnrQ.text: Fish'n'chips! It's a British staple and as a theoretically born and bred Londoner it's something I get a craving for every now and then. I've used many avenues to keep this addiction of sorts going from the greasy chippy on the way home, to a full sit down meal at the Anchor, and even cooked it myself once or twice after an early morning trip to the fish markets. Feeling too lazy to do it myself, too healthy for a chippy, and being on my own, I decided to try the Fish! Stall at Borough Market. This is attached to the glass-walled restaurant and they seem to do a brisk business so I figured it was worth a shot. You start off on the right side to place your order, and a cod and chips will cost you close to a tenner. A bit more than the chippy but not unreasonable. The cod was cooked perfectly with moist flaky flesh, a crisp batter, and most surprisingly a distinct lack of oily aftertaste.  The piece of fish is massive too, roughly a foot long and 4 inches wide but I still demolished it in no time at all. I could have happily knocked out another one without batting an eye, it was that good. This chips were thick cut and tasty but soggy and lacking any crunch whatsoever. A bit of a fail and definitely a let down after that fish.The most annoying part is that they charge you for tartare sauce (something I believe is an essential component of fish and should be included for free) and then there was no tartar sauce in my order. If you are going to charge make damn sure you get it right.Overall, it was a spectacular piece of fish worthy of 4 stars but loses out due to poor chips and lack of quality service. 3 stars because I'm feeling happy today.

uQatYUqTVIxwmbL_zfD3CA.text: Came here for dinner and even though we had reservations at 5:30 and showed up at 6pm, we didn't need it.  They had lots of empty tables.  The one we went to was under Borough Bridge.  We ordered the fried calamari for appetizer and for our main dishes, we ordered steamed Sea Bream and steamed Line caught wild sea bass (bass is from Spain).  The fried calamari was lightly fried and I thought the sauce was okay but the calamari was rubbery and that should not be the case for a seafood restaurant.  I originally was going to order the Sea bass from Canada, but changed my mind.  We ordered the fish steamed because I thought it was the best way to test out the product and let the product speak for itself.  I do not think beer battering the fish and frying it does the fish any justice.  I had sea bass with the herb and butter sauce and my wife had the Sea Bream with the salsa verde sauce.  In terms of how the fish were cooked, they were cooked perfectly.  The meat flaked right off.  Despite that, everything else was a subpar.  I had 5 fish bones in my fish.  That's unacceptable for a place that specializes in fish.  I did try my fish with a little of the butter sauce, but I thought it made the fish too buttery and overpowered the product.  The salsa verde sauce did match the Sea Bream but it didn't elevate the dish to a new level.  The presentation sucked.  I could have gotten the same presentation and quality of food for a lot less money at Redondo Beach in the States.  Because this place was more on the pricy side, I thought the meal and presentation would have been more elegant and flavorful.  The vegetables on the side were not seasoned and just steamed, just soggy vegetables.  The service was excellent at the beginning, but deteriorated towards the end of the meal.  My glass of water was never re-filled and our waiter never even paid attention to it.  I didn't bother asking him to re-fill it to see if he would ever notice throughout the meal, he never did.  That's just terrible.  As other reviewers have mentioned, the 12.5% discretion fee is not a discretion fee, it's a mandatory fee.  I came here with a party of 2 and they still charged me that fee.  Hence for future reference, this fee is mandatory.  I don't mind paying the fee because they do list it at the bottom right corner of their menu, but my waiter did absolutely nothing!!  I would never come back to this place and I do not recommend this place for anyone.  STAY AWAY!!

mPj7jpfzzS_7qDPH_ktVig.text: Decided to check this place out with my cousin after wandering around the London Bridge area. After being sat down, we didn't see our server till ten minutes later. We ordered our beers, a Peroni and London IPA, an appetizer of calmari which came with a rocket and lemon mayo and ordered our entrees of Haddock fish and chips with mushy peas each. Our beers came about thirty to forty minutes later, even after the appetizer and I'm not sure how I even lasted that long. I felt like I was on boiling points on MTV but I was patient enough to wait. Finally I had to call some people out and start cussing out loud a little calling out the horrible service and comparing it to how it would be to the states. The fish was great though and the meal was enjoyed but the service was horrible as even our server changed to another during the time for no reason. Never coming again.

QYhm0YPJEeSHkY8v0WoBbA.text: MMMM fish an chips! My second time trying fish and chips :)soooo good, I got the cod and chips (french fries for Americans) and it was so freken good! And the portion is huge, I tried so hard to finish it but couldn't do it. Will go again with boyfriend who will finish the job for sure.Btw, its in the borough market, which is a great plus plus!

y8b9GwjgumQecLLKPRMO8g.text: A. The outside dining area was very roomy and abundant with umbrellas; I was able to eat without sweating into my mealB. The bacon filled squid was off-the-chains; it was this long tender cylindrical squid body about 6" long, filled with crunchy bacon...exactly as written on the menuC. The bloody mary was very strong and spicyD. The cathedral view from the dining area was multi-piture-worthyE. I went on a Sunday when the market place was closed so it wasn't so hecticF. Price was pretty steep (I finally found out the pound to dollar conversion, ouch) but worth itG. Waitresses were boom-bangin (I call it like I see it)I will definitely hit again.

U2fEKchIbuy-K-0wDpTORQ.text: I was really shocked that this place got good reviews. In my opinion, it is overpriced tourist trap in the borough market. We went here after we were too late for breakfast in near by Las Brindisa thinking we are ok for the breakfast here. In addition, we got enticed by the cozy seating in their terrace especially on a sunny Saturday in London, so we decided to give it a try. Ohhh boy, big mistake! We had the calamares salad  and found  9 pathetic medium size rings over rockets leaves and ok sauce for £9.99? Really? The fish soup I ordered was lacking flavour and meat. It was mostly like waterdown fish broth that was not worth £6.99 a bowl. Nothing else was really worth ordering especially the £16 fish and chips! Outrageous!! Obviously the innocent tourists, who do not know any better are willing to pay for such hefty price. I hope they are really good but after the disappointing appetizers, I think not. I suggest you take your appetite and hard earn money elsewhere.

V2N8LH_kINDCn8UVxhYFFQ.text: The Salmon with herb butter is supreme, the best I have had in ages. It is something that cannot be describe with words, but is to be tasted.

FjwB8f5T_lAj3P_Q2KkVkw.text: Wow...great location and cool ambiance but horrendous service and below average fish & chips.  The reviews and location brought us to this place but the rude waitress and over battered fish will never bring us back.  Skip it!!

UEVJ4qlmZK5kitv6VKYF5g.text: Fish! is both a restaurant and shop which sells great fresh fish at the front of the building and cooks it at the back. The restaurant itself is a bit posh, in keeping with the Borough setting of foodies and cashmere. However, the service is not a all snobbish and I would really recommend this place for a great laid-back meal. The waitress didn't even think twice about whether it was ok for me to have a slightly bigger starter for my main course and adapted the prices accordingly.Unfortunately, our experience here was slightly marred by the fact that my boyfriend and I were both recovering from bad colds. The heating in the restaurant seemed a bit obscene especially since I had an air vent blowing powerfully behind my feet. To this day I'm not able to tell if I was my own personal body temperature to blame or if other customers felt the same.Nonetheless, the food was great and service very efficient. Fish! isn't cheap but it's rare to find food this fresh that is. Well recommended!

kKStgTbBw6cP-jDPXEa2Ig.text: I have been to fish! a number of times over the past few years and it's a decent backstop if you are in this area and are in need some impromptu fodder. If you have planned ahead and you want to eat fish at Borough Market I would recommend Wrights Porter and Oyster bar which will give you wonderful food and a great experience at a similar price. I turned up at fish! this Saturday with six other chaps who had joined me on the stroll along the river from Richmond to our destination, Borough Market. After a pint at the Rake we felt the need for some fish and chips so, it being a Saturday night, fish! was our only realistic choice of getting a walk in table anywhere near Borough Market unless we fancied a curry. When we arrived the restaurant was almost empty so it was no problem being found a nice table despite being rigged out in our urban walking gear. Even with its conservatory type feel, the acres of glass and a kitchen fully open to the dining room this in not a restaurant I would call swanky or a destination type place. If you are looking for a special occasion venue, or somewhere for a romantic rendezvous, this would not be on any short list of mine. However, it's a pleasant enough space although it has no real soul and is a bit lacking in atmosphere. In the main I would say it is frequented by tourists, out of towners and locals who find themselves in Borough in need of some food to keep them going through the evening. Having said all that, and dammed with faint praise, it suited us boys well enough after an 18 mile walk. Cod, chips and mushy peas all round was the order of the day once we had managed to catch the eye of our underemployed but still quite charming waitress. After only a short wait, quite a bit of which seemed to be spent on the pass while the waiting staff got themselves together, our fish supper arrived and it was a pretty decent meal. The fish itself was a fresh, chunky fillet enclosed in a tasty batter, which if it had been left in the fryer just a moment longer would have been overdone. The chips only rated an ok, no problems but nothing to write home about and I even left a few. However, the mushy peas were damn fine and drew murmurs of admiration from the two Northern lads who were in our party; trust me I think these boys would know a good mushy pea when they tasted one. At £15.95 for fish and chips this is bordering on the eye watering in terms of price but the quality and the location was good. We washed this down with a couple of bottles of the house white which was fine but pretty bog standard. The boys grudgingly saying that it was a decent fish supper and it should be at that price as we trudged through the Market for a nightcap at the Porter seemed to sum up the experience very well.

BQfMllecVKsseihBeY_zLg.text: i would like to give this place another chance but sadly, i was only visiting London for a week and only had one chance to come here.  My friend and I stopped in to grab a quick snack to share and ordered the fried calamari.  While it was well seasoned, I pretty much was chewing on sand with every single bite.  That's pretty much the worse thing EVER!  Even still, i'm giving it more than one star because the seasoning on the calamari (minus the sand) was pretty delicious.

ACUkYVCyu57lftuQe4wmOg.text: We went to fish! right when it opened so we were the first and only people there for the majority of our meal.  It is a beautiful restaurant and very clean.  The hostess and our server were very polite, although when we asked for a recommendation our server said he did not like the cod, which we got anyway and it was delicious.  Great experience for my first fish and chips in London!

mJPiZpm3-W3BPG5mPkLgOg.text: For the take-away counter outside the restaurant, also fish!We waited our turn. Friend was in town from Ukraine and I'd heard fish! was good. We ordered the cod. Went to check out and had to pay ADDITIONALLY for tartar sauce. Come on, this take-away counter outside was steep enough but additional? And guess what, I didn't like the tartar sauce at all.A party of five shoved past us (they were behind us) to grab the only five stools to sit and eat. When our food came, we used those useless wooden forks to pull apart the battered and fried fish to share. My friend had to find a knife to help us cut it. And it was mushy. Seriously, mushy.Two hungry ladies with no desire to even finish the over-priced fish. Fail.

Is9uZe9zuDYFTKs4CvZzsA.text: We loved this place.  Located in Borough Market, the location is a must visit for any foodie traveler.  The fish and chips are probably amongst the best I've ever had. I'm not a fan of mushy peas, so they didn't appeal much to me.  The beer battering was phenomenal!

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Yum! Cod with chips and mushy peas!

T75UQr2GO_ovFjyfdj8x8A.text: Started with Thai Fish. Amazing. Wonderfully flavorful.Then the main course. I had the traditional Fish and Chips with Mashed Peas. The fish was wonderful and not the least bit greasy. The mashed peas side was a pleasant surprise. I recommend taking a big appetite and trying as many dishes as possible. Really good food!

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Great atmosphere

DZF6LwYlxMR7bB4lxS-LRg.text: The interior of this restaurant is really cool (glass enclosed place in the heart of Borough Market) but the food is just so-so.  My halibut and roasted potatoes was fine, and my other dining companions enjoyed their fish n' chips.  A bit pricey for the quality of food that you get, but you are in London so what do you expect?Solid wine and beer list and great location.

CGPdi-rkVtObyotuYXWn7Q.text: Tourist trap. This is for the take out kitchen which isn't that good. Fish are pre cooked and only heated when sold. Batter is super thick and the fish wasn't very fresh. Avoid if you really want quality cod and chips.

TPhbLzhb-eq59jIVazezMg.text: Fish and chips were good enough. I think if you grew up on this stuff you're better to judge than me. I just can't get excited about British chips when French fries are just so much better. If you're going to eat junk food, might as well do it right. Some people complained about the tartar sauce. My fish soup was average. Friends calamari were fairly good and fresh. The restaurant is pretty inside. And if the weather is bad and you want to sit down vs. eat at the usual borough vendors, it was an ok choice. I thought the prices were 'London fair' © for what could otherwise be a tourist trap. The servers where really polite and fast, although the market was dead while were there. The real service test would be on a Friday or Saturday.

pzSY9yGdgv835xyOefFUVA.text: I liked these fish/chips - the fish tasted fresh and the frying definitely added the fat to make it taste great...the side of chips were a nice complement to the flavorful fish.  If you're in the mood for fish/chips, this place is a good option.Their menu has enough to satisfy most palates.

cAXep1BBiRtjl6EHi2A3nw.text: I go here regularly with a friend who works round the corner. I love the location and the staff are friendly. The best things on the menu for me are the lobster (but its quite pricey), the fish cakes and the fish soup. I wouldnt think of coming here for fish and chips though its more a place if you like fresh fish and seafood but expect to pay a premium.

dxj6iKYXPJtLB9pfEPAS0Q.text: Fantastic food and the wine is beautiful, it felt wrong sitting down at a restaurant whilst in borough market, but I'm glad I did! Two starters and a glass of French wine ended up at £20 which I thought was reasonable, but 20% service charge meant I didn't bother with a tip.

tkk8UCzc3SpJnbWulrQrDA.text: Over priced. Horribly, horribly over priced. The fish and chips was fine, but not stellar. The cheapest fish and chips they have is 17 pounds. In England fish and chips should run you about 5 pounds.

iwprq9GO2lXP65IFzWeF8Q.text: Loved the fish and chips. Would go back again. Thought it was a little pricey, but the pound to the dollar was a killer. They definitely have delicious food though.

M4D-GPaRM5MvzxTr7EdiFg.text: I don't know how this compares to other chip shops in London, but as an American it beats the heck out of any that I've tried here!  This is the takeaway counter for Fish! (which is a sitdown, and has longer hours), and it is right next to it in the middle of the Borough Market.  We got there maybe 15 minutes before they were closing on a Saturday night, and they were friendly enough, even though they were clearly trying to clean up to go home (or out for a drink, who knows).  The portions were huge, and even though I don't normally like cod much, this was delicious.  It had a crunchy crust even after dousing it in vinegar and walking back to the hotel, and the fish itself was flavorful without being overly fishy.  The chips were so good that I ate 2/3rds of them through the side of the container while we walked.  The only complaint I had, and this may be standard in the UK but was a surprise to me, was that you have to ask for tartar sauce and pay for it as an extra, rather than it being included in the price.  Not a big expense at 45 pence, but it'd be pretty disappointing to walk away without it because you forgot to specify!

sZ1RaPcj-vbaWJZYLd7xUw.text: Very good fresh food with incredibly nice staff.I went with my parents, brother, sister in law, and 11mo old niece who they happily accommodated with just-off-the-printer colouring sheets and crayons. The cockles appetiser was fantastic and, because there were so many of us sharing it, they doubled up on the portion size with no extra charge! It was the first time my father had ever had cockles and he absolutely loved them. My mother got the seafood salad, which she liked but I wasn't a fan of. Three of us got fish and chips (one plaice, haddock, and halibut). I liked the plaice the best but I prefer lighter fish in general. My father is a halibut fan and loved his - I found it too meaty. My brother got a fish pie, which he was a bit nervous about because the fish/cheese combo is a bit odd to us but he loved it. Overall, the food was clearly freshly made - I enjoyed seeing the kitchen right in the middle of the restaurant and watching them prepare some of our food - and high quality. Definitely worth another visit.

OWk02iImyVF6GYpHv3VSSg.text: 8.95£ for that massive box of really delicious fish & chips? And inside of Borough Market?! I must be dreaming!But no, it really is true. The first time I came here with a friend, we realised that there really isn't any need to buy two f&c boxes between two people- one is more than enough. In fact, had we each bought f&c box we agreed there was no way we'd have been able to finish it alone.My only complaint would be the apparent lack of outdoor seating- but given it's a take-away stand, that's understandable.All in all- great stand, and always a lovely excuse to go shopping at Borough Market (plus it's easy to get to- just outside the London Bridge tube exit and then next to the Green Market entrance!).

_ibldEYlfK9WvrAnukdHbw.text: Came early on a Thursday and had no trouble getting a table before theater at Globe. Whitebait starter was excellent-crisp and good portion and delicious sauce. Mains of specials-cod cheeks with samphire and grilled gurnard (a fish we did not know but is delicious) w autumn squash were both well cooked and nicely presented.  Big wine list-tho fairly costly. We had a nice and refreshing white. Music a little loud but service attentive and atmosphere very pleasant. We will definitely return and try other dishes on the menu.

nt7w9RuMEYB5MZN6cdB27w.text: Decor: The location of this place couldn't be better. Right in the middle of the lovely Burrough Market, this place gets a good amount of traffic. That said, it really is just a nicer/larger food shack- there is a VERY limited amount of seating to the side and most people end up standing and eating or just walking away with the goodies.Service: The people who work here are pretty quick and efficient, so I appreciate that. You may have to wait just a bit while they fry your meal (FRESH!)Food: Ah yes, so of course, I had:- Cod and chips: the cod was really really amazingly flakey! I was pleasantly surprised. It was hot and freshly crispy and the batter was really right on. The chips were also nice and hot and I definitly didn't complain! Load up on your personal choices of ketchup, vinegar and salt :)- Risotto Balls: I LOVE RISOTTO BALLS! And they do a really good job of them. They didn't look like much but once I opened them- WOW! Check out the pictures I posted!Overall: It's a go back for me and a go there for you!

SmpgRcygwAiYirQqWlMBxg.text: This restaurant is good for its fish (as the name alludes to) and is one of only a handful of sit-down restaurants in the Borough Markets. I'm a huge fan of the buzz of the markets and there's such delicious organic food everywhere that it took me a while to eat at Fish!The service was friendly and professional and we enjoyed a nice quiet lunch on a Friday. The fish is absolutely fresh and you have the choice over grilled or steamed fish with a variety of sauces.I ordered the organic salmon which was a little over-cooked but my friend had the wild sea-bass which was absolutely divine.Portion sizes are small for the price (15-20 pound mains) so big-eaters beware, however this was an extremely satisfactory lunch.

R8RhxY5ZIeV-lfLMYhNO9Q.text: had the mackeral fish bap from the takeaway hatch outside. Was great tasting service was standard. Was quite cheap. happy days

p1Kj1qIV6Ng3B9SSsDnG7A.text: Nice enough big fish restaurant with consistent menu and efficient service. Think maritime gaucho grill. I do have the feeling that its best days are behind it however. Time for a reinvention perhaps?

tck3tYS5kcQjTBJNy-WWiA.text: We had a quick bite at the take-out shop right next door. There was no line and we saw our fish fried up and served to us immediately. (Tartar sauce is extra, despite the sign out front.) My chips were old-ish but my husband's were nice and crisp. The battered fish was huge, tender, and flavorful! Our meals with drinks were about 25£. Would be 5 stars if my chips were crispy, too...

xvd5SRib0pIZvlZX_nvqrg.text: I had the Cod and chips and thought it was really good . If that was all I ordered I would have given a 4 star but my daughter ordered a kids fish and chips and it was not great. With the kids plate you don't get a choice of fish and the fish was not near the quality of the adult plate. Kids plate was 10 pounds and adult size was 17. My advice would be to  give kids the same option on the kind of fish as the adult plates because the adults will more than likely sample the kids fish.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Cod and Chips

MW4ztEcVTDNL5nhxxMReOg.text: Went to the smaller food stall they have next door on a food tour (Secret Food Tours of London) as one of the spots on the tour and had to come back.... Didn't realize it but it was too late and the market stall was closed so I ended up grabbing a table inside the restaurant, which didn't disappoint! Got there around 6:30 and the place was still pretty empty but it quickly filled up. I'd say grab a seat early and inside if you can.... it is under the London Bridge after all and traffic will get loud outside. I had the fried haddock with chips and mashed peas, a market punch and sticky toffee pudding with vanilla ice cream. The fish was perfect not a lot of seasoning but a slight fresh yeast flavor to the batter. The chips are cooked three times apparently, first time boiled in water and that ensures they're not at all greasy but a nice crisp potato. The market punch was nice and refreshing as a cocktail and went very well with the meal. Lastly the pudding didn't disappoint, the only thing I would add is another scooping of ice cream! Although I got something simple there were a variety of seafood selections around the very packed tables.... If fish and chips are not your thing I'm sure they'll have something for you as well (but not steak ) Very good meal indeed!

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. The sticky toffee pudding served hot with a scoop of ice cream! Yummy!!
Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. A very fresh and proper fish and chips dinner with mashed peas. Delish!
Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Market Punch! Very refreshing with a little kick :)

z7btt7CInBbO6D0zm2KFCw.text: I never understood the hype behind fish and chips, but I was in London so I had to try it out. After eating here, I still don't understand the hype. One of my pet peeves is bland food. I got the cod fish and chips and it was bland as anything. The fish wasn't seasoned at all, and I had to douse it in ketchup, lemon, and malt vinegar to choke it down. Same with the fries. The tartar sauce that I had to pay extra to get was also unseasoned. Sure, the fish and chips had some crispiness, but there's no excuse for under-seasoned food, especially one of the most iconic dishes of Great Britain.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Cod Fish and Chips. Bland as anything

jd57r6Fz4pK6nY7a3EjGkA.text: Bit of a tourist trap.. the fish and chips is good but bl**dy h*ll, it's expensive! You get exactly same at a no frills joint but here you pay 17-21£ for it.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Fish, Chips, Mushy peas

2DGK15-y0ThOjxL22FfAjg.text: Went to the outdoor fish and chip counter at Borough Market and it was the best fish and chips I had all week in London. Do yourself a favor and stop here for some take away.

mHwQw7NbYD08iEuXjKBULA.text: No research on what and where to eat, just stroll around Borough Market.  Came across Fish!, National champion of Fish and Chips, fancy kitchen in the middle of the restaurant, chic, stylish and friendly staffs.  Fish & chips and set dinner menu £25 for sardine on toast; while lemon sole with hollandaise, finish with apple crumble, feels like a bargain.  Thick piece of cod wrapped with crispy batter, no point describing how good it is, it is a winner!  The grill lemon sole is fresh and that's probably all I can say to that, hollandaise was surprisingly lack of flavor, imo.  4 is fair I think!

OB1iiYnjxOSOuLNl0pyQjQ.text: Best fish and chips in London! Great price too. The seating area is a bit tight during market days. But we went back on Sunday when the market was closed and there were plenty of areas to sit.

H0ShoqmQyIuFT421W3P-mg.text: Nicely designed glass restaurant with efficient and friendly staff. Looked very clean. Service was nice and fast and tasted very food. The portions are nice and great value for money. Loved the fish cake. The classic beer battered fish and chips with mushy peas. Grilled octopus with a tangy tomato sauce was tender and delicious.

f5-lCuuox9lP9fe1FOZvaw.text: They have a variety of fish to get your fish and chips fix fully satiated. However, I went with an order of fish risotto balls with smoked haddock and cheese. Wait, it said balls plural on their sign, yet I only got 1 ball. That was fine, it was really good and I recommend adding the curry sauce to go with it. Service was not very nice though and when I got to the center of the ball it was cold. Flavor alone would have gotten them 4 stars, but I had to subtract one for the other detractors.

-1J8mDhucvP8SqvcLBH1cg.text: First time having fish and chips and it was delicious! The fish, we picked the code, was huge! It tasted really fresh! I only wish that it was seasoned but other than that it was a nice experience.

Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

2CYSbzl5mn1EWbb0xH_k0w.text: Went again and found it overall more pleasant.I guess it pays off to go when the Borough market is not completely packed!Also I would recommend the lobster - very tasty!

M4YdAHDmer1IRt1-VRlzog.text: Had a little trouble making a reservation on line but called and they got us in.    Once there had a lovely meal with the house soup (bisque) then I had a great lobster grilled to perfection.   The server must have known I was an American because he didn't bristle or roll his eyes when I asked for ice water.   He provided a generous supply of ice and water.  My partner had a lovely cooked to perfection sole that he loves.   We were pleased with the attentiveness and pace of service and enjoyed our server.    Will be back

Fku0pAIaHRxcMeqWlNlDzg.text: The atmosphere and design of this place really saves it, for me anyway. I was only visiting London for about 4 days and felt I could have ate somewhere with better food/value, especially near the Borough Market. I LOVE the glass ceiling concept and whole style of this place but without that, I would rate it a 2 due to how dry my Swordfish was and it really lacked flavor. I got it with the herb butter, which you would think would make it more moist, it was so dry. So sad because swordfish is my favorite and this meal was kind of expensive. I also had the brushcetta which was good, at least I could taste the garlic so I was happy with that. Oh I had a Mimosa which was really good and my boyfriend had a latte which was delicious, so there's that too. I would probably come back if I lived in London, but unfortunately, I live in the US so I probably won't be able to give this place a second chance.

q-WZoF_XXsLK_Jta5vYAPg.text: Really busy fish restaurant near Borough Market with loads of people and a great vibe. Came in here with a huge group of bloggers for an event so we had a set menu to choose from- I went with the prawn cocktail, the swordfish steak and vegetables and the bread and butter pudding for dessert. The prawn cocktail was huge and super filling so could barely eat my swordfish but it was cooked just right-medium rare and tender. I usually love bread and butter pudding but the custard had a film on it and was a bit cold. Would have preferred it nice and hot with ice cream. White wine was really nice. All in all enjoyable, it's a big place with plenty of tables or you can dine at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Prawn cocktail

Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Friends quotes

ls3QX9sm6avPn5m7AdckzA.text: Perhaps it was because I went in to my trip thinking that London would be expensive, I didn't have the same reaction to the price that many of the reviewers here have. Maybe there are better places in the city to get fish and chips at a better price, but as  a tourist, there's no way I would know where they are. I got the catch of the day and it was exactly what I came looking for - fish was cooked nicely, the batter was seasoned well, and the chips were hot and crispy. It was very good! Throw in the spicy tarter sauce, and I left with a smile on my face and checked fish and chips off of my London to-do list.Is it a tourist trap? Possibly. Is the food good? Absolutely.

OVEXp1lHcb1fQp1M_SvKOg.text: Worst fish & chips shop! Tiny piece of fish, over cooked jacket. Pea mash taste completely tasteless and liquid like water. Chips are not fried twice, became creepy quickly. Totally amazed by how horrible this place is. It is simply benefited from a good location in the Borough Market, nothing more!!! Try not to go there. Btw, the New Forest cider taste like rotten apple...

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Horrible taste, don't bother to try.

4aWTNkOCFkoJz_RnJUVXCA.text: The grilled halibut with butter and herb sauce is delicious! That combined with a full gin and tonic menu makes fish! an excellent spot to have dinner.

-N5hcNBAvKEIFEk1uN_eBg.text: Perhaps 3.5 stars.I love fish and chips restaurants that serve more than just the classic battered and fried cod with chips. This is certainly one of them.We went on a Sunday evening around 8 pm. The place is quite huge, actually, with both indoor and outdoor seating. There were no tables filled outdoors, but inside there were a few. Most of the place was empty, though, so no reservation was necessary at that time.We were given our choice of table and our serve was very nice and pleasant. She answered all questions and offered suggestions.We ordered 1 classic beer-battered cod fish and chips, which were also served with mushy peas. The peas had quite an earthy taste, but the fish was great and the chips were good, but nothing to write home about.For our second dish, we ordered off the a la carte creation menu in which you choose one of about 10 different types of fresh fish and can request it either grilled or steamed. After some debate, we ended up trying the plaice and requested that it be steamed. The plaice is a very soft, flaky white fish. This was served with skin and had a very unpleasant taste. I will be fair and say I don't think it's the restaurant's fault, but plaice is not really the fish to choose, I think. We should have gone with the classic cod if we wanted a flaky fish or probably the swordfish if we wanted something steakier. Anyway, these grilled/steamed fishes are served with a vegetable garnish (fennel, carrot, cabbage), but we requested chips in lieu of the vegetables and they kindly obliged.We also ordered a tomato and onion salad with dressing on the side. When we received it, it had been dressed. When we informed them of the mistake, they immediately replaced it and apologized.The restaurant is quite expensive, but I appreciate the plentiful choices and good service. Also, it's very open and airy, which is nice. I'd recommend it, but I am not dying to go back.

UDE5OcC7NVeErW8-tflMKQ.text: I probably shouldn't have built up the anticipation or craving for fish and chips a few days into our London trip.... this restaurant being our first taste. Based off of the advertising stickers on the restaurant exterior wall, it was voted something like "Best Fish and Chips in Borough Market".. but makes me think what other options there were to choose from?We went with the classic cod and haddock fish and chips, a meal that amounted to over $80+ USD (think we also ordered a beer, but honestly for the amount and quality of food, I'd much rather have gone to a hole-in-the-wall place.) Portions were generous, but fish was way too oily/greasy in my opinion.

KMdqKHL9_l8Er6sHOt_4Mw.text: The American's perspective.This American boy just had fish and chips last night. Now I am no fish and chips connoisseur but my meal was pretty close to perfection. The cod was nicely fried and the serving size was just enough. I didn't feel like I overate at the end of the meal nor did I feel like I only ate an appetizer. There was a nice crisp on the outside of the fish and tender meat inside. I wish the chips were a little crispier but that's okay. Fish & Chips and a Peroni. I was a satisfied man at the end of the meal. You can chose to either sit in the restaurant or grab a quick bite at the takeout stall outside. There is a price difference if you want to save some money. The downside is the seating is limited at the takeout stall.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Cod fish and chips

4GzU0zfTKhIWHcBq-BYatw.text: Tried some fish & chips at their takeaway storefront. I had the cod & chips which were scrumptious. The fish melted in your mouth and the had all the toppings including vinegar and ketchup. Piping hot!Definitely be ready to takeaway your fish and chips. There is a small bench around the corner, but it is squishy!There are other type of fish options and some drinks as well, all around £9-10.

edPUbgOTmFKiT4V2psA7Fw.text: Nice looking place with a great fresh fish smell as you walk in.  Unfortunately it did not totally live up to expectations.My friend had the fish soup and it was bland. I ordered fried mussels and cockles dish and it was the opposite, to heavily covered in a thick spice that was like chewing sand. Avoid. I originally wanted the oysters but they were out.The fried calamari however was excellent. Definitely worth ordering. Get this!Main course was fish and chips which was market price cod. It was nice but truthfully i noticed no difference from ordinary cod. Home made tarter sauce was nice and chips were cooked well. Don't bother upgrading the cod though. I wish it would have had some batter as no real crunch or texture. My friend had a bacon wrapped fish entree with pumpkin. It was good and I would get this instead.All in all this place is nice enough but I think if I went back I would order differently outside of the calamari.  For what it cost (around £55 with bottled water and no wine) I think it was ok but it just didn't blow me away.

sXr4eMdqV8lvNyr_0_Nj-g.text: Fancy restaurant in the middle of Borough Market. Was looking for soup since I had a cold and this was the only place close by. The service was great but definitely overpriced.

7XWGMKtOPopCRGZ5Bx7NEw.text: Delicious dinner at fish! this week, beer battered wild halibut, mushy peas, good crab cake starter too

Cod fish and chips and I had the sea bream steamed with garlic butter. We got a nice wine to match and had a great time!Cons: it was a little pricey. 3uA6CiXN2MATCaShpDTTrA.text: Really tasty! I really like the thick cut fries but wished I got some tartar sauce for my fish! The food came out at a decent time and it was served piping hot with a nice crunchy outside texture and soft juicy inside. We came after the market was closed so there was no line. They do have a seating area, but it was all filled. The fish and chips came in a box so we were able to just take it and fine a curb to sit on. The condiments and such are located on the large table where people were eating, so it was a bit awkward to interfere with their space for ketchup.... I think these items should be put on a tall table so that people don't need to get into each other's face... i found the price to be fair for the amount of food we got. We only shared one and it was doable... if you aren't starving. I wouldn't call the service friendly but they aren't rude, just very quick. It seems like if you become a regular they'll treat you like family.... if you plan to come just be prepared to find seating elsewhere.... or go into the restaurants right next door. I'll definitely be coming again.

lRIhDz2-o47NFLEYHaf81g.text: Had fish and chips at borough market. They first of many fish and chips during out stay. It held it's own against the rest. Enough said.

-kpIfIX_d3Vk2wpSiJ0gag.text: I visited the restaurant's takeaway fish and chips shop that's located right next door. I smelled the delicious, greasy goodness and had to get an order to share. There will most likely be a long line but locals told me that you can phone ahead and they'll have your order waiting for you so you can avoid the line. The portion size was large and plenty for two adults to share as a small snack. Several varieties of flavored ketchup and malt vinegar are provided free of charge; you'll have to pony up a little extra cash if you want mayonnaise or tartar sauce. There are different varieties of white fish (Cod, Haddock, Halibut) and what you get depends upon what's on offer that particular day. They say they serve fresh fish purchased from the market that day so availability is dependent upon what's the fresh catch of the day. The halibut will cost a few pounds more than the other fish varieties. I honestly can't remember what type of fish we were served but I do know that it was hot, fresh, and flaky. The beer batter wasn't greasy at all and had a lovely crunch to it. The chips were even better (but who doesn't love fried potatoes)? Note that there is very limited seating as this takeaway stand is in the bustling Borough Market. If you are lucky enough to get a stool take it immediately! Open 7 days a week and late on Friday and Saturday nights!

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Beer battered made to order fish and chips from the adjacent takeaway stand. So good!
Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Look at that fresh, flaky goodness. Delicious.
Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. A nice sized portion and plenty for two adults to share as a small snack.

q1YobGPewlRMYO3CmtSvZQ.text: Probably the best grab and go fish and chips you'll find.  Not the best I've had but did hit the spot on a Sunday when most everything else is closed. Man, does that set a bar or what?

tJV1JHm_UVAkkaaiui7Daw.text: The fish and chips are great. It was a little hard to find with apple gps though. The restaurant was beautiful, a great bar area and nice window views. The restaurant is also in the middle of a market full of deserts, foreign food, cafes and many other tents.  Would dress business casual though.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

AMaNNrD6l8dGDE3X3k7oeA.text: Great evening here with my cousin in the bustling Borough Market, which I LOVE. The restaurant itself is very "casual" posh, and has a great vibe and atmosphere. As for the best fish and chips in London, which I heard they got for 2017? I don't think so...The crust was super hard and the portion was small. Peas and chips were just OK. Maybe I just was unlucky. These things can happen depending on who is cooking, etc. Our Spanish waiter was friendly and funny, but so dingy. He couldn't get our orders straight... I think he was still dreaming about his weekend trip to Spain, which he kept talking about. Haha, though. He was entertaining....and a sweet guy. Finished off with a toffee pudding, which was very nice. In all, loved our night there but mostly because I got to see my cousin. We hadn't seen each other since 1983!

BiDBVYwuYZeEvIdWhiUYqw.text: Went to the Borough Market street vendor location. Ordered the Cod Fish and Chips. Fish was fresh but the batter lack flavor a little to subtle for my taste and the abundance of tourists hoarding the condiment bar didn't help, since I wanted to add some vinegar to my fish. Might have been better to sit down in the restaurant.

_nUOPI5l5957zDiw2LHzFA.text: I had a haddock sandwich from the restaurant's stand in Borough Market. The outdoor stand is next to the restaurant. I liked the sandwich; it was served on sourdough bread with a generous amount of tartar sauce. It was a typical fried fish sandwich. It was good but not different than fried haddock from other London locations. I'd try other fish and chips options before returning to this stand.

Rc9jf6Cl2SVu8zEzcLCNHQ.text: I came here with my boyfriend while on vacation, for some fish and chips! We actually got fish&chips at the fish! stand next door inside the borough market earlier in the week. Then on our last day in London, we decided to eat inside the restaurant. We had an early reservation, so there was nobody inside, and were seated right away. I actually ordered a tuna burger which was amazing, and my boyfriend ordered beer battered cod & chips, which was delicious just like the one we had from their stand. I read somewhere that this restaurant had one of the best fish&chips, and I most definitely agree. If you're in London, and craving some fish & chips, I'd recommend this restaurant!

jbb3AWHDdjaLdgIn_jfUkg.text: Thank you for the best fish and chips I've had in my life! The crust was so crunchy for being so thin and it really let the fish shine. Chips were hot and crisp! I just wish I had bought more tartar sauce to go with it.

N2-rrbwDBPmNgDgiBrFMew.text: I just want to mentioned that after dining in this restaurant I was laying in hotel room for three days. Diarrhea

M1MGib3XNXOHDKxt8EUQog.text: Stopped in here whilst shopping in the Burroughs marketplace to warm up a bit.   The decor is nice with lots of glass windows.   We ordered the cod fish and chips, the marinated anchovies and a few negronis.   The fish and chips were pretty decent.   Best in London (per their claims)?   Doubtful.What was the star of the table were those marinated anchovies.   So simple yet so delicious.   They provided toothpicks as utensils for these which reminded me of Spain.   Would return for the negronis and anchovies.   The F&C, not so much.

qrgJuN4rbGpDvLixvXb5YQ.text: So we decided to hit up the official Seahawk pub in London for the 2018 game vs. The Raiders, but it was pretty much a no go due to how packed it was and the enormous line that followed for the wait list to get in, so we decided to go down some stairs, and it led us to a pretty cool street market of food and drinks. Well, everyone else had the same idea, and places were quickly filling. Since we traveled with a large group, not too many places were accommodating. That is until, we came upon this place. They had a large outdoor seating area, and we were able to fit our group over three large table settings. We ordered some drinks, which were pretty damn good, and some apps with desserts. The calamari was beautiful crisp and just perfect. The dessert, which was a warm bread pudding, was incredible!!! Seriously delicious and perfect, with enough cinnamon and raisin to savor the flavor. My first time ever having this type of dessert. The Bloody Mary were good, as well.Our waitress, cute as a button, was having a hard time, though, with handling the orders and remembering who had what. I even caught her rolling her eyes a few times when patrons were standing in her way, when asked if we could pay our bills, and she had no idea who ordered what, and how much. She actually said this, "Please write down what you ordered and then I'll tally up your bill. She pretty much had no record of ANYONE'S orders. I totally get it, though... it's a busy night, lots of people, maybe she wasn't feeling well or maybe she just didn't like us Seahawk fans, who knows... but to be rolling your eyes, making faces... you have to know body language sometimes speaks more than words... and her body talk that night was that she was irritated, tired, or just plain out didn't care to be there, who really knows. Either way, it was good food, great times visiting with friends, and our overall experience was pleasant... it could just do without the attitude. That's why I'm not giving this place a higher star rating. As always, enjoy and Happy Eating!

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

sy6XumJyLerhFeFg5vaLRQ.text: The chips were a 3 since they were a little soggy when I'm used to crispy. The fish was flaky, good quality, and not greasy. This place uses halibut. I also had a lemon and thyme beer which paired well with the fish. It is hectic at the Borough Market and it was a Saturday.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

CV69J4gLbAunkhWZrI94ZQ.text: You have to eat fish and chips when London and this restaurant advertises that it is the proud winner of the National Fish and Chips Award.  Sounds good!  And, it was.The restaurant advertises on a flyer that it brings its fish in fresh every morning from its own "fishmonger ".  What makes this place different is that you can choose from a number of available fish filets.  I had the swordfish and Chips .  Delicious!  And, it came with lots of chips.  Malt vinegar readily available as a British custom. You can go around the counter and watch the fry cook battering and frying the fish.  It is all done in plain view behind large windows.  They also have grilled fish, nice!  On the day we were here, cod was the most popular.

vp-3AhwsdBN44n0hV_uORQ.text: Likes:-fresh hot fish-lots of different fishes on the menu if you get there early-haddock was larger than the size of my hand-I didn't realize that you can order online for pickupDislikes:-I'm not a huge fan of thick cut fries cuz they're often mushy-few options by 3pm so go early. I could only chose from haddock and cod (haddock is bigger but fishier)-not a lot of seating outside by the to-go hut-not cheap street food for 10 pounds/$14 USDOverall, it was good but nothing out of the world but it may have been because I went late

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Haddock & cod were the only choices left

cn-uETjsxgDCOEy8zShakg.text: A hard day at the spirit of Christmas show at Olympia so nice to go somewhere familiar. Yes fish n chips this time. Washed down with a bottle of Prosecco. Very nice and good service as ever. Interesting to see some familiar faces among staff so that's good too

_NsAAVUBhxq32Wc_6aLOQg.text: The fish and chips here was by far the best I've tried so far in England. Mind you I've only had a chance to compare two restaurants.Haddock - crispy thin batter and not too oily.Mushy peas - a traditional side dish.Tarter sauce - shallots, chives, and creamy smooth. (wow - 5/5)Partizan lager - a pilsner

R1fPgCb5mbn6IWv6IigDDQ.text: Out of the different aromas of food in London's Borough Market, my nose scented the smell of Fish! I'm not so much of a fish eater, but prior to my visit I did find a tastier fish and chips in Notting Hill. Since Fish! Is labeled as "The proud winner of the National Fish & Chips Award" I felt I could be in a roll to find another good place. I went for the "Cod & Chips" (9.95). I did like how they serve a thicker piece of the fried cod. But the downside its mildly battered so the outside is not as crispy. There was a few bones within the meat, which it doesn't bother too much though. I believe their dipping sauce is their specialty, I didn't like it so much because It tasted like a combination of tartar sauce and coleslaw. I added some of the Sarson's malt vinegar for flavor, however it didn't help so much of it already being just an average fish. The portions of the chips was decent and they were good enough to be as a filler. We ordered a side of the "Mushy Peas" (2.25). It was the first time trying it this way. It's simple, creamy and lightly seasoned, it wasn't too bad. Overall, the experience was okay. I got excited at first but it lacked a little in tastiness. I do like their creativity in their tartar sauce, its different but it wasn't for me. Fish! Is a cool and casual food stand. Solid 3 stars.

We barely made it here before closing time and the staff was very courteous. We didn't feel rushed considering we arrived 10min before closing time.The place has a nice ambiance. E9TKE344dSotq03ROs9u9Q.text: There was a line here and we decided we should probably try fish and chips since we were in London, so we got in line. 4IqMV3nq1LxS62Gm2c_D3w.text: After drinks at shard we were looking for a place to eat and found this place by accident. It's one of the best seafood resultant. Lucky we got the table as soon as we entered, no wait time! I had classic prawn cocktail which is a starter. It was cooked to the perfection. Only problem was peeling prawns which is hateful task at late night. Service and hospitality: 5/5Ambiance: 4/5Food taste: 5/5Dish and presentation: 3/5 - this is bcoz I had to peel the prawns! Drinks: 3/5 - they almost ran out of wine and had to settle on something which is in between for me.But I would love to visit again as at the end taste and hospitality matters!

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom
Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

xDLy_32ZQqwD7DnhwHWrxA.text: Pretty disappointed in this place. I was pretty excited to try fish and chips in Britain and saw an advertisement to try this restaurant.My brother ordered the fish and chips and I ordered the grilled fish. Both items were pretty bland. The mashed peas which came as a side to my brother's food was probably the best part of the meal. The one thing that stood out about this experience was the very poor service. Our waiter did not take the time to meet our needs. At one point I told him the meal was not what I expected and he told me to give it a shot. The ambiance was actually pretty nice and is the primary reason I would give any rating. I would also advise diners to beware of the price. Our order was about 70 pounds for an unremarkable meal we could have gotten at a pub.

8FQUSapOUAL1EvYtDZY7Eg.text: Best fish and chips I've had! The fish is delicious and the crust is deliciously thin and not too oily. The chips aren't too bad either I must admit (being Belgian myself I always consider them better at home  so I'm very severe on their quality abroad and trust me when I tell you they are well above average here) It's obviously well known in the area, the queue is long and consists mostly of locals. The price is reasonable for what you get and they're very nice. You will have to walk a while to find a seat though. Their chairs are scarce for the clientele they have and the few benches in Borough market are always full. The best thing to do is to walk towards the Tames and eat on a bench there. It's only two minutes away.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

xoqVTUZfoWaWUDyAzGqT-g.text: Hands down, the best fish & chips I've tried during my stay in London. The batter was incredibly crispy and thin, so it didn't overpower the fish. It was easy to eat with my hands because the batter didn't crumble! (Unlike many others I've tried). The chips were okay, but I'm not a fan of thick-cut fries. 5 stars for the fish, -1 for the chips.

FzGG8-OcdPZOPP8_QZnGog.text: Great food, but a little overpriced for what you get. I have to commend them for their perfectly cooked & fresh salmon, however with little additional seasoning added and a small side of vegetables, I can not justify the price. Moving on past the food however, the restaurant is perfectly located in Borough Market (which ups the menu prices) and the restaurant atmosphere is clean & large (suitable for groups).

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom. Grilled organic salmon with hollandaise sauce and a side of spinach. Really good!

UnP4n4V5orwEBQYDB8odQg.text: After we left the Anchor Tap by Tower of London we were walking back to our hotel and came across this marketplace and found fish!.  Trapezoids of glass created the exterior form of the restaurant and interior was brightly lit with open concept. Intrigued by the design we walked in and were immediately greeted and seated. After perusing the menu we both opted for the Halibut fish and were not disappointed. Fresh, Flavorful and Filling was our Fish!. Staff was attentive, prices matched the quality of the dish and ambiance was nice and cozy. This could be a nice place for a date or to hang out with great friends. Big Fan!

7aEIXBBfu1NucA9cu0jW4Q.text: Great service and a delicious departure from the traditional fish and chips.  I had the haddock with hollandaise sauce and poached egg...the best thing I ate in England.  Their fish selection is extensive and paired with delicious complementary sized.  I went back the next weekend and had their proper cod fish and chips from the walk up counter. It did not disappoint, fresh and flavorful served in a sturdy cardboard takeaway box.

JmoBVig113SXalEnIz0HWw.text: I was craving some fish and chips when I stumbled upon this place.  They said they had won an award for best fish and chips so it was settled.  Honestly, I'm not really sure how much better the fish was than anywhere else, but it was definitely cheaper than getting some at the pub.  I'd say I saved about £4 by going here instead of a pub.They also have a lot of different fish types here.  My brother ordered the grilled swordfish and said it was good.The one major drawback is that there's really nowhere to sit and eat your food, so we ended up eating on the side of the road.  It's a huge issue, but  be prepared.

OCuheqg2BX_LPVAZh9mFuQ.text: Order some fish and cocktail. Very slow service for not so busy day..Food and drinks were delicious. Really conveniently located in the borough market, with nice open seating.  Very nice choices in fish food and daily specials seemed well thought of..Slightly pricy , but the location demands it. If you seat yourself outside, there is an extra benefit of enjoying the aroma of all the little eateries around it..

tOyRP7faUPq8-FQQZIY0lA.text: Great fish and chips! The batter was not too thick and the cod was fresh (no fishy taste). The chips were nice and crispy. This was the first time I've tried mushy peas and didn't care too much for it but, the meal was great! Definitely recommended it!

8lmt7wfAm9PBjTXrqU9v6Q.text: Food was fresh hot and tasty!  We had Swordfish and tuna grilled, sides were excellent and the bread was good.  Wines were a decent value.  I would do 4.5 but cant.

h0KzjHszgeHT4dzv7pyb9Q.text: Fish!, set in the middle of the bustly Borough market exceeded my expectations. We had lovely outside seating and a personal friendly waiter who gave us help with the wine list. We had a very nice Riesling to start with our oysters, smoked salmon and devilled whitebait. The oysters were very fresh and served with shallot vinegar- lovely. Our maincourses were light and fresh, you can either have a set dish or select your own fish, how its cooked and which sauce to serve it with. I had monkfish, which was plainly grilled with salsa verde on the side and steamed carrots, corguette and chicory. Very good! We ordered a second bottle of the Riesling but it wasnt as cold so they kindly bought us a bottle of the more expensive Pouilley Fume for the same price. Over all its a great place to eat whether it be a casual lunch, a business meeting or a romantic al fresco treat.

-83sei78D8amD4MwLpDKuQ.text: This place was great!  The selection was just incredible and the waiter was great.  I had the swordfish club sandwich which was bigger than my head (and a great deal more delicious I'd wager).  Good selection of beers, great location near Borough Market and great food.  Definately going to be returning to this spot.

a5SYm-FFJsIY1eoa8JQqWA.text: I had been looking forward to this after finding them on-line and reading their menu. My husband and I went there for lunch. I chose the 2-course lunch. I chose to have the whitebait which was excellent. Fresh fish, lightly coated in breadcrumbs with an aioli dip. Not greasy at all. This was followed by fillet of sole which was pan fried with some sprouts and minced parsley I seem to remember sprinkled on top. This came with sea asparagus, a nice surprise. It was also surprisingly salty and made up for the lack of salt on the fish. My husband order a la carte starting with smoked salmon which also was excellent. However his fish(cod) and chips was a real study in contrast for while the chips were excellent - nicely crisp and not oily - the fish was simply inedible. It was powdery. The batter was good enough if somewhat oily. We complained and the restaurant took it off the bill. Overall the mains were quite oily (my sole was verging on being swimming in oil) and there were hits and misses. Not consistent. Would I recommend this place. Yes but be prepared to experience hits and misses. Staff and service was excellent.

y9gBKvLdlOcwzdRd3oVKmQ.text: This place is strange but good... it is decorated in a non-traditional fish & chips shop manner... much more modern and "funky" but the fish & chips is really proper fish & chips

PFbTmwmGLJDc1QAGtf3izw.text: Solid fresh seafood in simple preparation and a nice variety of decently priced wines. Perfect break from the bustle of the surrounding Borough Market but they do have a heated outdoor space if you wish to be amidst the buzz.

zyY4rcQzAPxOgPiojUs-Ew.text: Part of the Fish chain bit good location and usually quite lively. Worth visiting for reasonable value fish dishes although I am told that for seafood Wright brothers across the road can't be beat

R0Tiu9mnG9HDXXmTHY40HQ.text: Fish! Is located in the heart of Borough Market, just near London Bridge station.  I've been here a couple of times and the food has been really great: the fish is super-fresh and tasty, fairly reasonable priced,and the staff are always really nice.  Good wine list, beers and spirits, great decor and a really easy-to-follow menu.  You can choose the way your fish is cooked, and Fish! boasts the best mushy peas around. I had my first-ever Fish Pie here and I LOVED it, plus the servings are really decent (I couldn't finish my Pie and that is very unusual for me!)

LgQhwNjpT_I_XOHqnpXvAg.text: Sea starsIf you like fish, you'll like Fish ! And if you can think of a fish, it's probably on the menu. Like the Wagamama of seafood, "Fish!" has a slightly canteeny feel, but this isn't really a downside. Good value, well cooked food, with knowledgeable friendly service and a great wine list. Caters well for kids and perfect for sating your appetite after a visit to the Saatchi Gallery - although it might not be appropriate to follow an outing to the aquarium...

yNZimbMlejOJoWf_d5u_Lw.text: Forget polystyrene trays, tasteless fish and grease sodden chips. The fish and chip stand (an extension of the stylish restaurant) brings fine quality to takeaway food. Fried to perfection in a fragrant, light beer batter and served in paper boxes, this is high end takeaway cuisine at its best. I have never paid this much for fish and chips but once you tuck into them it is worth every penny.

PqcW6JaT3lvPfAnhCqOjzA.text: Fish! is the restaurant owned by Jarvis the fishmonger.  Jarvis started out as a fishmonger in Kingston in 1942, opened a fish and chip shop next door and then Fish the restaurant with a take-away outside.Basically, you choose your fish..... halibut, skate, cod, tuna, plaice etc etc, choose whether you want it grilled or steamed, choose the sauce.... herb, hollandaise, or whatever and choose the side dishes and it arrives with some steamed vegetables (pak choy and other interesting stuff).  Alternatively, you could go for the traditional battered cod or haddock with chips and muchy peas or even order a steak.  The chips here are sublime, crunchy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, (fried twice natch) just perfect.I normally go for steamed halibut with hollandaise and their wonderful chips, once I have finished mine I point out interesting architectural details to whomever I've arrived with and while they are looking at the wrought iron or the kitcen I stealthily munch their chips too.On market days, this is in Borough market after all, their fish and chip shop, which is separate from but adjacent to the restaurant, is serving traditional battered loveliness direct to the street with chips and mushy peas.

ILgLBVVMWisqLMbtovefBA.text: As much as I love how Fish Kitchen is a small independent takeaway, I really do wish secretly that there was one on the end of each high street in London.  Why is there no chain of fish and chip restaurant in London? Regardless, the fish and chips here are truly delicious and the staff are extremely friendly, if not flirty.After hours of tasting cheese and olives in the cold, there is nothing i enjoy more than splashing out 7.95 on a plaice and chips (and mushy peas for an extra 1.75) and sitting on the bench of Southwark Cathedral, with a glass of mulled wine. Friday afternoons have never been better, though if I am in a rush the fish finger buttie is an excellent compensation at only 4.95.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

RfUPbJ68XgTR8tMBt6nMXg.text: We were at Borough Market when hunger quite naturally hit. I had my eye set on raclette, but after seeing the 30 or more people in line, I changed my tack. At this point, the goal was hot food, quick food (it was cold and we hadn't eaten all day). We spotted fish! and decided it would be perfect. We got the cod and chips and it was amazing. The cod was fresh and delicious, with a nice batter. There was no shortage of chips. Honestly, there was so much food, 2 people could quite easily split one order. Tip: take your fish and chips to the courtyard outside the Southwark Cathedral and people watch.

fPQ_QZBvtV36iF3Qo_JOsA.text: Fish! Kitchen (the little side fin of Fish! around the corner) sell only one thing - fish and chips. Ok actually that's two things and there's mushy peas so technically it's three, but imagine going up to a counter and saying, "fish please". The world would slow down in expectation of the next few words and I am pretty sure you would find yourself on reruns of Ripley's Believe It Or Not if they are never uttered.Right I am writing a whole bunch of nonsense really, but if you are going to eat a British classic (no stay away from John Cleese), then make sure it's good quality and in it's entirety.With fish stocks decreasing by the second, it's not a plaice I go to often - I just feel too guilty. But the fishmongers claim it's all from sustainable sources. There's cod, haddock, plaice and halibut, a large portion in light beer batter. It's fresh. So are the chunky cut chips. Higher priced than the normal frozen stuff out there but it's natural that it would be.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

jgUilePiWDEuZrOwHl5gxQ.text: I guess I just don't get it. A rather average meal in a pretty venue that charges an awful lot.I came her for dinner late on a Thursday night. I had the fish, monk fish to be precise, grilled, and some chips... and it just wasn't all that interesting. Small portion, and rather expensive. The flavour was very neutral, bland even. The restaurant looks nice, but I guess that's what you're paying for. The hours were convenient, it's solid, just not really worth it.

emmq02vxNEsc1rKjkedLxQ.text: On the edge of Borough Market where eating while standing up is the norm, fish! offers a nice reprieve. Open and airy as light pours in which was great on a sunny Saturday afternoon in December. Although I had no reservations, I was seated in a very busy and buzzing dining room. The patio was also available warmed by heaters but I chose inside to feel the vibe of fish! and not that of the market.House white, Trebbiano, Abruzzo was refreshing for lunch but step it up to a featured wine at dinner. This one lacks after dark. The fresh offerings are checked off on the menu for your information and available steamed or grilled. They were out of monkfish (one of my favorite) and John Dory so I shoes the skate. But first, the fish! Soup. Wow. Light and refreshing.  Would have been great served in a cup to take away and drink while shopping the market. Worth stopping in just for fish! soup. The steamed Skate with spicy salsa was nice. Cooked well and easy off the bones. Very enjoyable. While I did not go with fish! and chips, offered as haddock cod or halibut, it looked great and was very large on the plate not the newspaper. Many parties around me chose that direction and cleaned their plates.The short, it !fish is a great place to pop in for lunch when near the market. I would not think of it as a dinner destination.

G6T1SZUbGONJ-Ukm_JWTlA.text: Fish! I love Fish with exclamation marks! Right inside Borough Market this is the restaurant attached to the saucy looking Fish and Chips shop. My father is a big fish aficionado, so I took him here knowing he'd be delighted with the menu. They have an a la carte menu of traditional meals like fish and chips, fish pie etc - total comfort food. Also lots of really great dishes like monkfish, crab, seafood. You can order anything from the fresh fish selection and choose your sauce, side dishes and potato, fries accompaniment. The thing about Fish is that they cook everything so well, the food is top quality. We had a great time chatting with the friendly French waiter, stuffing ourselves with the bread basket and trying my father's weird looking starter of devilled whitebait.

29p5L-PLJ8fpU2_Bvu_CJQ.text: I'm not actually a huge fan of fish and chips, mainly because it is so rare to get good fish and chips. The usual high street fare is pretty substandard with the odd good shop here and there.I was taken to Fish! the first time a few years ago and have been there quite a few times since. The food is top quality, well prepared and my usual indifference for chips disappears when confronted with the delightful way in which they are cooked here.

vw-CTZiW-AKecVj3y-EEBQ.text: Nice, spacious restaurant in a memorable setting. Food was very good though very expensive (something I didn't realize because I wasn't doing the pound-dollar conversation in my head very well). Service was a bit overbearing and our wine somehow took a long detour before it finally got to us.

ej-cY21Dv3ullr4tn1z9YQ.text: Always fresh fish on the menu. In Borough Market so you can pop in after a bust morning/afternoon of shopping. Standard fare of English food, with accents of the Mediterranean in the garnishes. Great sticky toffee pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

DZ3LSrOGtlF5hbPV3ji80Q.text: We found this place amidst the organized chaos that is the Borough market. Very cool neighborhood and very delicious market. The fish & chips here were super tasty and came with mushy peas-yummmmm. The outdoor seating is great, lots of tables under the largest umbrella I've ever seen. primo for people-watching. Its not cheap, especially for us Americans, but it was worth it for the food and experience.

g8Jod5RV6yS-2SzF-yKePg.text: It was absolutely delightful to stumble upon Fish! while exploring Borough Market right after we got off a 10-hour flight.  A single-piece fish & chips for £7.95 from the stand comes with a huge sizzling piece of flaky fillet  and coarse cut chips hot off the fryer.  It may be cliché but personally there is nothing more quintessential than wholesome fish & chips to start off a visit in London.

photos.caption: Photo of fish! - London, United Kingdom

iNWcqBLXxUUHP5ZxH-ZPqA.text: Love this place! Great little treasure in Borough, absolutely love the fish and chips which I would get pretty much every time. Scallops were wonderful as well! Definitely a must when visiting London or if you live there and are in the mood for some great food.

jGkEUKjTUIsuldNthmLHFw.text: Go here one in a while to catch up with friends the fish is the best quality you can get in London. I had Calamari with rocket and lemon mayo, and the lobster with chips as a main which was pricey but worth every penny. The fresh fish with sides is always cooked well and they make fab thai fishcakes. This is definately a must for fish and seafood lovers

Ii1d7TpU9VQcLehyk3Ti0A.text: Very tasty very fresh fish, steamed or grilled. A great place for low carb lunches with vegetables and lemon juice, especially on a sunny day

21wRv1iLZH7A5uE8Zfw-MQ.text: To be found in between Borough Market and Southwark Catherdral, fish!  serves a comprehensive range of good quality fish, of which most is sourced from the fish stalls within the market. A long airy, open space, the structural steel bars which hold the glass roof up join together to form what looks like an abstract fish bone. You can see the chefs at work, and when I went years back they used to yell out "fish!" very loudly as soon a dish was prepared, but unfortunately I don't think this happens now. The Thai Crab Cakes with Sweet Chilli Sauce is oh so good, and actually relatively filling. But you do want to follow suit with one of their fish steaks from their lengthly fish option. The Organic Salmon is grilled just so that the meat breaks off well, and not the least bit dry ( which can easily happen when over cooked). Next door, if you don't fancy eating in the restaurant, you can order a portion of fish and chops which is definitely substantial the £6 or £7 that it's worth.

xMdlSQxwMNQM31HpBC3FqQ.text: What a lot of these reviews fail to mention is that there is the posh restaurant section where you need to shell out 15 quid a fish and chips meal, but there is also a outdoor stand with about 4 seats outside or for takeway. The fish and chips in a box is about 7.50 which by most fish and chip stands is above average in price, but I can definitely say that its one of the best fish I've had at a stand. I guess the restaurant gives a halo effect!

gX9tIOqIZ80FMMULmWyX3w.text: Fast service, delicious food and lovely staff! Fabulous place to go for lunch. It has a nice open airy feel, like dining in a conservatory... Fab. Go there!

zTRaczjBpTN1iCj6EmxrBQ.text: Just had lunch here today and enjoyed it a great deal, even though it was quite pricey.  It was chilly and raining and I didn't have a reservation, but even though I showed up at the height of the lunch rush the hostess was very gracious and managed to find me a seat at the counter.  That was great because watching the cooks on the line was excellent entertainment.  The food was equally excellent.  I had fish (cod) & chips with mushy peas.  A huge, crispy, freshly-fried piece of fish occupied half of the plate, while excellent chips occupied most of the other half.  Flavorful, hot, and fresh.  What more could you want?  I don't normally spend so much on lunch, but in this case, it was worth it.

H1Pif3_5uKJqZXoumzMSeA.text: Great location, great fresh fish and excellent cooking... but I felt the price of a standard fish and chips is too much (£15.95), even if it did taste like heaven... you can get the same heavenly fish and chips at your favourite local chippy. Great for a treat and a nice restaurant sit down, but I'd say if you're just looking for somewhere to eat in the area, grab something YUMMY off the market.
